alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 06 at 5:55PM MDT until June 06 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 555 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Pueblo West. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southwestern Pueblo, Pueblo Reservoir and Pueblo West. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
